p: Diabetes mellitus is a metabolic disorder characterised by hyperglycaemia. It has been demonstrated that diabetes is associated with several lower extremities orthopaedic conditions and complications that affect the quality of life (Ay et al. 2020). Diabetes accelerates bone loss, osteopenia, and osteoporosis by promoting osteoclast function (Wongdee and Charoenphandhu 2011). Reports of delayed bone healing (Ajami et al. 2014; Marin et al. 2018), reduced growth plate thickness (Stalvey et al. 2017), and increased cortical porosity (Osima et al. 2017) support the incidence of compromised bone quality in diabetic subjects. Therefore, appropriate attention is warranted for elucidating mechanisms underlying bone microstructure changes associated with diabetes.
